title: "all repot yas and mal for wasting my time with 4 aug"
body: > AFKs for 21 minutes instead of dodging

replies.body: Just report and go on, assholes don't get how people are not obligated to follow their self created rules

> [{quoted}](name=Telephone Booth,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Bh9nLEKE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-26T05:35:34.737+0000)
>
> What?

Someone didn't like the team's builds, so instead of dodging and eating a 7- or 15-minute penalty, he AFKed in a match that lasted 21 minutes.

It's not his fault that his try-harding team refused to surrender knowing full well that their team mate wasn't playing which takes just a second to do. Vote surrender, restart, new team, game on - all in under 5 minutes. There really is no reason to continue playing out of malice just to spite the one player who is trying to go for a different mission - its stupid and immature.

That the AFKer was trying to do is motivate you to do the reasonable thing and surrender. That way he doesn't get the unfair dodge penalty and you don't get the unfair 4 player match. Win - win -win. Too bad your bravado and selfishness led to a less favourable outcome that you yourself didn't seem to appreciate.

Win - win -win. Too bad your bravado and selfishness led to a less favourable outcome that you yourself didn't seem to appreciate.

Why should five people waste five minutes of their time because one bully didn't want to spend seven minutes of their own time doing something else? How is that fair? If they go through champ select knowing that they won't want to play the match ahead of them, they're supposed to dodge. AFKing and/or inting are not appropriate, and reportable.

Also, a couple matches after the 21-minute loss, we had another asshole who did the exact same thing, AFKing because the rest of us didn't have two augs (he and one other player had two, another had three, and the rest had four). It took nearly half an hour, but we actually won. And he won, because he was there, even though he just stood there sulking instead of helping.
